Summary Josh Perkins is currently the manager of the Global Accounts Payable programs and projects team; leading accounts payable through the next generation SAP implementation (ECC 6.0). Josh’s responsibilities include the accounts payable implementation and stabilization of next generation SAP procure to pay program.  This program includes new master data (CVM), invoicing (PO, NonPO, Websuite), payments and reporting.  Josh is also responsible for Optical Scanning (FDMS), duplicate invoicing program (First Strike), electronic invoicing, Direct Materials, and the Capital Replatform and their impact on Accounts Payable operations.  Josh has been with Intel since 1996.  He spent his first two years at Intel as a Program Manager in the Motherboard business unit.  Josh has spent his last twelve years working on SAP enterprise system projects.  He started on the IT project team implementing SAP R/3 3.0 and SAP R/3 4.6B.  He was a lead systems analyst for both the invoicing and payments areas during his four years in project development.  Josh also managed 3rd level AP production support for two years prior to moving over to the Accounts Payable Operations Programs and Projects team. Josh holds a bachelor’s degree in Finance from Linfield College and was defensive captain on their American Football team. Josh also has a MBA from Washington State University. Josh lives in Hillsboro, Oregon with his wife, Trudy, who worked as a technical Program Manager in IT at Intel for 8 years (prior to starting a family) their two sons, Calvin who is seven years old, Wesley, three and their new born daughter Monica (June 2012).  Josh enjoys team sports, snowboarding and traveling to tropical locations. Specialties:SAP, Enterprise Implementations, System Programs, Accounts Payable Operations, Program Management, People Management, Managing Shared Service Center.
